properties.description: This is a wellbeing cafe for adults who have mild mental health difficulties or who feel isolated. We provide a quiet shared space where it's OK to not be OK. There are opportunities to come and share a hobby, learn a new one, enjoy the peace in our quiet area or chat and relax over a cup of tea or coffee. Optional prayer times are held for anyone who would like to join us. We are available Tuesdays between 2.00 pm and 4.00 pm

properties.description: Pedal Power is an inclusive cycling charity located on the edge of Bute Park. As well as cycling for all abilities we also have an on site cafe serving hot and cold lunches, coffee and cake. Our café is an accessible space, used to welcoming wheelchair users, community and third sector groups. Everyone is welcome with a space to sit and chat, make new friends or rest after a walk in the park or cycle ride.

properties.address: King Square, Barry, CF63 4RW
properties.description:
Free refreshments (teas & coffee) are being offered from 12:00 - 16:30, Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, come along for a cuppa and a good read. - Children and Youth Area - Community Room - Free computer and Internet access with scanning and printing available - Free WiFi - Photocopier - Fax service Weekly Activities for Adults:
• Knitting Group • Colouring and Jigsaw Club • Crochet Club on Thursday • Coffee Morning on Friday • Caffi Cymraeg for Welsh learners The Barry Friends and Neighbours Group Credit Union meetings Weekly Activities for Children:
• Rhyme and Sign - Singing sessions using baby signing for ages 12mths-4 years
• Bounce and Rhyme - Singing sessions for children aged newborn-12 months • Children’s Colouring Club for 5 years+
• Amser Stori with Menter Iaith Bro Morgannwg, • Tylino Babi (Baby Massage) with Cymraeg i Blant Bro Morgannwg
• Storytime - Story and craft for 2–5-year-olds
• Lego Club – Ages 6+
